name: Lynch Syndrome
content:
• Genetic Testing for Hereditary Cancer Syndromes

    A fact sheet about genetic testing for inherited cancer risk, including types of tests, who should consider testing, how to understand test results, and who has access to a person’s test results. Also contains information about at-home, or direct-to-consumer, genetic tests.

  • Genetics of Breast and Gynecologic Cancers (PDQ®)–Health Professional Version

    Genetics of Breast and Gynecologic Cancers includes information on BRCA1 and BRCA2 variants (breast and ovarian cancer) and Lynch syndrome (endometrial cancer). Get more information about hereditary breast and gynecologic cancer syndromes in this clinician summary.

  • Genetics of Colorectal Cancer (PDQ®)–Health Professional Version

    Hereditary colorectal cancer syndromes include Lynch syndrome and several polyposis syndromes (familial adenomatous polyposis, MUTYH-associated polyposis, juvenile polyposis syndrome, Peutz-Jeghers syndrome, and serrated polyposis syndrome). Learn about the genetics, clinical manifestations, management, and psychosocial aspects of these and other hereditary colon cancer syndromes in this expert-reviewed summary.

name: Cancer Research Ideas
content:
• Cancer Research Ideas

    An online platform for cancer researchers to submit their best scientific ideas for bringing about a decade’s worth of advances in 5 years, making more therapies available to more patients, and spurring progress in cancer prevention, treatment, and care.

name: Gynecologic Cancers
content:
• Cancers by Body Location/System

    A list of all cancers, organized by location and/or function in the body. Cancers on the list are linked to information about treatment, supportive care, screening, prevention, clinical trials, and other topics.

name: Cáncer de faringe
content:
• Cáncer de cabeza y cuello—Versión para pacientes

    Información del Instituto Nacional del Cáncer sobre el tratamiento, la prevención, las causas y los exámenes de detección de los cánceres de cabeza y cuello, así como referencias a estudios clínicos, investigaciones, estadísticas y temas relacionados.

name: Mantle Cell Lymphoma
content:
• Adult Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma Treatment (PDQ®)–Patient Version

    Non-Hodgkin lymphoma (NHL) options include chemotherapy, radiation, targeted therapy, plasmapheresis, surveillance, stem cell transplant, and surgery. Learn more about types of NHL and treatments in this expert-reviewed summary.

name: Interferón
content:
• Inmunoterapia para tratar el cáncer

    La inmunoterapia es un tipo de tratamiento que ayuda al sistema inmunitario a combatir el cáncer. Obtenga información sobre los tipos de inmunoterapia y lo que puede esperar durante este tratamiento.

name: Careers at NCI
content:
• Careers at NCI

    Employment, fellowship, intern, postdoctoral, and advocacy opportunities at NCI.

name: Childhood Cancer Data Initiative
content:
• Childhood Cancer Data Initiative (CCDI)

    The Childhood Cancer Data Initiative (CCDI) is building a community centered around childhood cancer care and research data. Through enhanced data sharing, we can improve our understanding of cancer biology to improve preventive measures, treatment, quality of life, and survivorship, as well as ensure that researchers learn from every child with cancer.

name: Resources for Researchers
content:
• Resources for Researchers

    Resources for Researchers is a directory of NCI-supported tools and services for cancer researchers.

name: Physician Data Query (PDQ)
content:
• PDQ® - NCI's Comprehensive Database

    An NCI database that contains the latest information about cancer treatment, screening, prevention, genetics, supportive care, and complementary and alternative medicine, plus drug information and a dictionary of cancer terms.

name: Lumpectomía
content:
• Opciones de cirugía para mujeres con CDIS o con cáncer de seno

    Explicación de la cirugía conservadora de seno, la mastectomía y la mastectomía con cirugía plástica del seno y comparación de cada una de estas cirugías.

  • Tratamiento del cáncer de seno (mama) (PDQ®)–Versión para pacientes

    Resumen de información revisada por expertos acerca del tratamiento del cáncer de seno (mama).

  • Tratamiento del cáncer de seno (mama) (PDQ®)–Versión para profesionales de salud

    Resumen de información revisada por expertos acerca del tratamiento del cáncer de seno (mama).

name: Lip and Oral Cavity Cancer
content:
• Lip and Oral Cavity Cancer Treatment (Adult) (PDQ®)–Patient Version

    Lip and oral cavity cancer treatment can include surgery, radiation therapy, or both, and depends on the site and extent of the tumor. Learn more about the diagnosis and treatment of newly diagnosed and recurrent lip and oral cancer in this expert-reviewed summary.

  • Cancer Stat Facts: Oral Cavity and Pharynx Cancer

    A quick overview of frequently-requested statistics on oral cavity and pharynx cancer. Statistics are based on SEER data and include incidence, mortality, survival, stage, prevalence, and lifetime risk.

name: Provocative Questions (PQ)
content:
• Provocative Questions (PQ)

    The PQ initiative supports research projects designed to solve specific problems and paradoxes in cancer research identified by the NCI as understudied, paradoxical, or difficult to address.

name: Ooforectomía profiláctica
content:
• Prevención del cáncer de ovario, de trompas de Falopio y primario de peritoneo (PDQ®)–Versión para pacientes

    Sumario de información revisada por expertos sobre factores que pueden influir en el riesgo de presentar cáncer de ovario, de trompas de Falopio y primario de peritoneo y sobre las investigaciones dirigidas a prevenir los mismos.

name: Diccionario
content:
• Diccionario de cáncer

    Diccionario en español e inglés que ofrece 5 000 definiciones de terminología relacionada con el cáncer, lo cual incluye fármacos para combatir el cáncer, tipos de cáncer y tratamientos. Las definiciones nuevas son revisadas frecuentemente por un grupo de expertos del Instituto Nacional del Cáncer.

name: Time to End Cancer as We Know It
content:
• Time to End Cancer as We Know It

    First Lady of the United States Dr. Jill Biden touches on how the National Cancer Act represented an investment in people and science that has led to revolutionary advancements in cancer prevention, screening, diagnosis, and treatments.

category: Time to End Cancer as We Know It
synonym: Time to End Cancer as We Know It

name: ASCUS
content:
• Understanding Cervical Changes: Next Steps After an Abnormal Screening Test

    Learn what test results mean if a recent Pap test showed cell changes in the cervix or an HPV test was positive, including that not all cervical changes mean cancer; find out the importance of follow-up care and treatment for abnormal results.

name: Common Data Elements
content: • Cancer Data Standards Registry and Repository

name: Radiocirugía estereotáctica
content:
• Radioterapia para tratar el cáncer

    La radioterapia es un tipo de tratamiento del cáncer que usa altas dosis de radiación para destruir células cancerosas y reducir el tamaño de tumores. Aprenda acerca de los tipos de radiación, por qué suceden efectos secundarios, cuáles pueden suceder y más.

name: Cancer Risk Assessment Tools
content:
• Breast Cancer Risk Assessment Tool

    A web-based tool for health professionals to estimate a woman’s risk of developing invasive breast cancer.

  • Colorectal Cancer Risk Assessment Tool

    An interactive tool designed by scientists at the National Cancer Institute to estimate a person's risk of developing colorectal cancer.

  • Melanoma Risk Assessment Tool

    An interactive tool designed by scientists to estimate a person's absolute risk of developing invasive melanoma.

name: LiveHelp
content:
• LiveHelp

    Get live, online assistance from NCI's LiveHelp service. NCI Information Specialists on LiveHelp can give you information about cancer from the NCI. However, they are not health care providers and do not provide medical advice. LiveHelp is not a substitute for talking with a health care professional.

name: Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma
content:
• Lymphoma—Patient Version

    Information about non-Hodgkin lymphoma and Hodgkin lymphoma treatment, clinical trials, research, statistics, and other topics from the National Cancer Institute.

name: Ecografía
content:
• Diagnóstico

    Entérese de las pruebas y procedimientos que el doctor podría ordenar para conocer la razón de sus problemas.

name: Biopsia de seno
content:
• Significado de cambios y afecciones de los senos

    Información sobre los cambios y padecimientos específicos del seno, y sobre cómo se detectan, diagnostican y tratan estos cambios. Explica que todos los cambios en el seno deben ser revisados por un médico, a pesar de que la mayoría de estos cambios no son cáncer.

name: Exploración con TEP
content:
• Diagnóstico

    Entérese de las pruebas y procedimientos que el doctor podría ordenar para conocer la razón de sus problemas.

synonym: exploración por tomografía con emisión de positron

name: Health Information National Trends Survey (HINTS)
content:
• Health Information National Trends Survey

    HINTS collects data about the use of cancer-related information by the American public. These data provide opportunities to understand and improve health communication.

name: Linfoma folicular
content:
• Linfoma no Hodgkin en adultos: Tratamiento (PDQ®) (Profesionales de salud)

    Resumen de información revisada por expertos acerca del tratamiento del linfoma no Hodgkin en adultos. (Versión para profesionales de salud)

name: Hepatitis
content:
• Infectious Agents

    Certain infectious agents, including viruses, bacteria, and parasites, can cause cancer in infected people or increase the risk that cancer will form.

  • Liver (Hepatocellular) Cancer Prevention (PDQ®)–Patient Version

    Liver cancer risk factors include hepatitis B and C, cirrhosis, and aflatoxin (poison from certain foods). Learn about these and other risk factors for liver cancer and how to prevent liver cancer in this expert-reviewed and evidence-based summary.

name: Finasterida (Proscar®)
content:
• Prevención del cáncer de próstata (PDQ®)–Versión para pacientes

    Sumario de información revisada por expertos sobre los factores que pueden influir en el riesgo de cáncer de próstata y sobre la investigación dirigida a la prevención de esta enfermedad.

  • Prevención del cáncer de próstata (PDQ®)–Versión para profesionales de salud

    Sumario de información revisada por expertos sobre los factores que pueden influir en el riesgo de cáncer de próstata y sobre la investigación dirigida a la prevención de esta enfermedad.

name: IRM
content:
• Diagnóstico

    Entérese de las pruebas y procedimientos que el doctor podría ordenar para conocer la razón de sus problemas.

name: R21
content:
• Grant Mechanisms and Descriptions

    List of grant mechanisms, with descriptions and links to associated program announcements.

name: Spanish/Español
content:
• Cáncer en español - Instituto Nacional del Cáncer

    Página principal del Instituto Nacional del Cáncer que ofrece información en español sobre diferentes temas relacionados con el cáncer.

name: K01 Award
content:
• Grant Mechanisms and Descriptions

    List of grant mechanisms, with descriptions and links to associated program announcements.

  • Center for Cancer Training (CCT)

    CCT's mission is to catalyze the development of a 21st century workforce capable of advancing cancer research through a scientifically integrated approach.

name: Cáncer de lengua
content:
• Tratamiento del cáncer de labio y de cavidad oral en adultos (PDQ®)–Versión para pacientes

    Resumen de información revisada por expertos acerca del tratamiento del cáncer de labio y de cavidad oral en adultos.

  • Tratamiento del cáncer de labio y de cavidad oral en adultos (PDQ®)–Versión para profesionales de salud

    Resumen de información revisada por expertos acerca del tratamiento del cáncer de labio y de cavidad oral en adultos.

  • Tratamiento del cáncer de orofaringe en adultos (PDQ®)–Versión para profesionales de salud

    Resumen de información revisada por expertos acerca del tratamiento del cáncer de orofaringe en adultos.

name: Efectos secundarios de la quimioterapia
content:
• Efectos secundarios

    Información sobre los efectos secundarios más comunes causados por el tratamiento del cáncer, entre ellos, anemia, falta de apetito, sangrado y moretones, estreñimiento, infecciones y caída del pelo.

  • La quimioterapia y usted: Apoyo para las personas con cáncer

    Contiene información sobre los efectos secundarios que pueden tener los pacientes durante la quimioterapia y qué hacer para controlarlos.

  • Complicaciones orales de la quimioterapia y la radioterapia a la cabeza y el cuello (PDQ®)–Versión para pacientes

    Resumen de información revisada por expertos acerca de las complicaciones orales, como la mucositis y la disfunción de la glándula salival, que se presentan en pacientes de cáncer tratados con quimioterapia y radioterapia dirigida a la cabeza y el cuello.

synonym: efectos de la quimioterapia y la radioterapia

name: Smoking
content:
• Smokefree.gov

    Offers science-driven tools, information, and support that have been effective in helping smokers quit. Links to Smokefree sites for Vets, Women, Teens, Espanol, and 60+.

name: Tamoxifeno (Nolvadex®)
content:
• Terapia hormonal para el cáncer de seno

    Hoja informativa que describe la terapia hormonal y su función en la prevención y tratamiento del cáncer de seno. Incluye información acerca de los efectos secundarios posibles y de los fármacos que pueden interferir con la terapia hormonal.

name: Servicio de Información sobre el Cáncer (CIS)
content:
• El Servicio de Información sobre el Cáncer del Instituto Nacional del Cáncer

    El Servicio de Información del Cáncer (CIS) del Instituto Nacional del Cáncer facilita la información más actualizada y precisa sobre el cáncer a pacientes, a sus familias, al público en general y a profesionales médicos. El CIS brinda respuestas personalizadas a preguntas específicas sobre el cáncer y asistencia a los fumadores que quieren abandonar el hábito. Comuníquese con el CIS al 1-800-422-6237 (1-800-4-CANCER) o al 1-877-448-7848 (1-877-44U-QUIT).

category: Servicio de Información sobre el Cáncer (CIS)
synonym: Servicio de Información sobre el Cáncer (CIS)

name: Partnership for Accelerating Cancer Therapies (PACT)
content:
• NIH Partnership for Accelerating Cancer Therapies (PACT)

    PACT is a five-year, public-private research collaboration launched by NIH and 11 pharmaceutical companies. As part of this effort, NCI recently awarded grants to support four Cancer Immune Monitoring and Analysis Centers (CIMACs) and a Cancer Immunologic Data Commons (CIDC).

name: Multimedia
content:
• Recursos multimedia del NCI

    Colección de videos e infografías del Instituto Nacional del Cáncer (NCI).

name: Breast Cancer Statistics
content:
• Cancer Stat Facts: Female Breast Cancer

    Summary of frequently requested breast cancer statistics, including incidence, mortality, survival, stage, prevalence, and lifetime risk.

  • Breast Cancer Risk in American Women

    A fact sheet that provides statistics about a woman’s risk of developing breast cancer and information about breast cancer risk factors.

name: Medicamentos para el cáncer
content:
• Formulación y aprobación de medicamentos

    Información sobre medicamentos específicos y la formulación y aprobación de medicamentos.

  • Medicamentos aprobados para diferentes tipos de cáncer

    Esta página contiene una lista y enlaces a páginas del NCI con información sobre los medicamentos aprobados para tratar tipos específicos de cáncer.

  • Medicamentos aprobados para enfermedades relacionadas con el cáncer

    Enfermedades relacionadas con el cáncer y lista de medicamentos aprobados para tratar estas enfermedades. Los nombres de cada medicamento llevan a sumarios del NCI.

name: Cyclophosphamide (Cytoxan®)
content:
• Cyclophosphamide

    This page contains brief information about cyclophosphamide and a collection of links to more information about the use of this drug, research results, and ongoing clinical trials.

name: NCI Formulary
content:
• NCI Formulary

    The NCI formulary provides institutions and investigators that are part of certain NCI-funded clinical trial networks with rapid access to agents for cancer clinical trial use or preclinical research. It is a public-private partnership between the NCI and pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies.

name: ¿Qué es el cáncer?
content:
• ¿Qué es el cáncer?

    Definición de cáncer, explicación breve de cómo se origina el cáncer en las células del cuerpo, estadísticas básicas de cáncer y enlaces a otros recursos del NCI.

name: Cáncer de riñón
content:
• Cáncer de riñón (células renales)—Versión para pacientes

    Información del Instituto Nacional del Cáncer sobre el tratamiento del cáncer de riñón, así como referencias a estudios clínicos, investigación, estadísticas y otros temas relacionados con este tipo de cáncer.

  • Tipos comunes de cáncer

    La lista de cánceres comunes incluye cánceres que se diagnostican con mayor frecuencia en Estados Unidos. Esta página ofrece las estadísticas de incidencia y mortalidad más recientes para estos tipos de cancer.

name: Cancer Images
content:
• Visuals Online

    An NCI database of cancer-specific scientific and patient care-related images, as well as general biomedical and science-related images and portraits of NCI directors and staff.

name: Stereotactic Radiosurgery
content:
• Radiation Therapy to Treat Cancer

    Radiation therapy is a type of cancer treatment that uses high doses of radiation to kill cancer cells and shrink tumors. Learn about the types of radiation, why side effects happen, which ones you might have, and more.

name: Glioma
content:
• Brain Tumors—Patient Version

    Information about brain tumor treatment, clinical trials, research, statistics, and other topics.

name: Tamoxifen (Nolvadex®)
content:
• Tamoxifen Citrate

    This page contains brief information about tamoxifen citrate and a collection of links to more information about the use of this drug, research results, and ongoing clinical trials.

  • Hormone Therapy for Breast Cancer

    A fact sheet that describes hormone therapy (including antiestrogens, LH-RH agonists, aromatase inhibitors, and SERMs) and its role in preventing and treating breast cancer. Includes information about possible side effects.

name: Toxicity
content:
• Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events and Common Toxicity Criteria

    Resources for standard terminology used to name and to describe the severity (grade) of adverse events that occur in the treatment of cancer.

name: Tumor Biology and Metastasis Branch
content:
• Tumor Biology and Microenvironment Research

    Research in this area seeks to understand the role of tumor cells and the tumor microenvironment in driving cancer processes. Understanding the cellular, molecular, and biochemical interactions of tumors within their microenvironment is essential to improving cancer diagnosis and treatment.

name: NCI Website
content:
• About This Website

    NCI is the U.S. government's principal agency for cancer research. This website serves to disseminate authoritative, evidence-based, and up-to-date information about cancer and NCI-supported cancer research. Much of the information is available for content reuse and syndication.

  • Contact Us for Help

    Cancer information specialists can answer your questions about cancer and help you with quitting smoking. They also respond to questions and requests for information about NCI and its programs.

name: NCI Organizational Charts
content:
• NCI Organizational Charts

    Organizational charts from the NIH Office of Management Assessment showing NCI’s structure, including its divisions, offices, and centers.

name: Braquiterapia
content:
• La braquiterapia (un tipo de radioterapia interna) pdf file (200 KB)

    Información para personas que necesitan entender cómo funciona la braquiterapia (un tipo de radioterapia interna).

  • La radioterapia y usted: Apoyo para las personas con cáncer

    Contiene información sobre los efectos secundarios que pueden tener los pacientes durante la radioterapia y qué hacer para controlarlos.

  • Radioterapia para tratar el cáncer

    La radioterapia es un tipo de tratamiento del cáncer que usa altas dosis de radiación para destruir células cancerosas y reducir el tamaño de tumores. Aprenda acerca de los tipos de radiación, por qué suceden efectos secundarios, cuáles pueden suceder y más.

name: R01
content:
• Grant Mechanisms and Descriptions

    List of grant mechanisms, with descriptions and links to associated program announcements.

  • Research Project Grants

    Find current and recent NCI and Trans-NIH Research Project Grants (R01 and R21) that provide funding for specific areas of cancer research.

name: Human Participant Protection
content:
• Patient Safety in Clinical Trials

    There are federal rules in place to help protect the rights and safety of people who take part in clinical trials. Learn about informed consent, institutional review boards (IRB's), and how trials are closely monitored.

  • Protecting Human Research Participants

    This free tutorial is for physicians, nurses, and other members of clinical research teams. If you are an extramural researcher obtaining Federal funds, check with your institution to determine if this is the training they use to fulfill the NIH requirement for education on the protection of human research participants. This course is offered by the NIH Office of Extramural Research.

  • Central Institutional Review Board Initiative

    The CIRB provides an innovative approach to human subject protection through a "facilitated review" process that can streamline local IRB reviews of adult and pediatric national multi-center cancer treatment trials.

name: Office of Acquisitions
Division of Cancer Biology (DCB)
content:
• Division of Cancer Biology

    The Division of Cancer Biology (DCB) supports basic research in all areas of cancer biology at academic institutions and research foundations across the United States. As part of NCI, DCB provides funding for research that investigates the basic biology behind cancer.

name: Office of Cancer Centers
content:
• Office of Cancer Centers

    OCC supports major academic and research institutions throughout the United States to sustain broad-based, coordinated, interdisciplinary programs in cancer research.

name: Fanconi Anemia
content:
• Inherited Bone Marrow Failure Syndromes: Fanconi Anemia

    Information from the Clinical Genetics Branch of the National Cancer Institute.

  • Genetics of Skin Cancer (PDQ®): Squamous Cell Carcinoma

    A section of the expert-reviewed information summary about the genetics of skin cancer - basal cell carcinoma, squamous cell carcinoma, and melanoma.

name: Sistema nervioso central
Bypass Budget
content:
• About the Annual Plan and Budget Proposal

    Learn about the annual budget plan and proposal NCI submits to the President and Congress each fiscal year and find an archive of plans from previous years.

name: Medicina complementaria y alternativa
content:
• La espiritualidad en el tratamiento del cáncer (PDQ®)–Versión para pacientes

    Resumen de información revisada por expertos acerca de la influencia que tiene la espiritualidad y la religión en las personas que tienen cáncer. Se discuten varios métodos sobre manejo e intervención.

  • La espiritualidad en el tratamiento del cáncer (PDQ®)–Versión para profesionales de salud

    Resumen de información revisada por expertos acerca de la influencia que tiene la espiritualidad y la religión en las personas que tienen cáncer. Se discuten varios métodos sobre manejo e intervención.

name: Cirugía
content:
• Publicaciones educativas para pacientes

    Las publicaciones más consultadas del NCI están disponibles en formato PDF o pueden descargarse a lectores electrónicos, tabletas o teléfonos inteligentes.

name: Program Announcements (PAs)
content:
• Program Announcements

    Find current and recent PAs that invite requests for funding applications to support specific area of cancer research.

name: Cancer Trials Support Unit (CTSU)
content:
• Cancer Trials Support Unit (CTSU)

    CTSU is a pilot project sponsored by NCI for the support of a national network of physicians to participate in NCI-sponsored phase III cancer treatment trials.

name: Contáctenos
content:
• ¿En qué podemos ayudarle?

    El NCI ofrece información gratuita sobre temas de cáncer en inglés y español. Llámenos al 1-800-422-6237.

name: Division of Cancer Prevention (DCP)
content:
• Division of Cancer Prevention

    DCP supports research to determine and reduce a person’s risk of developing cancer, as well as research to develop and evaluate cancer screening procedures.

name: Adenocarcinoma
content:
• What Is Cancer?

    Understand how cancer cells differ from normal cells and genetics changes that cause cancer to grow and spread.

name: Grado de un tumor
content:
• Grado de un tumor

    Hoja informativa sobre el grado de un tumor y su papel en el pronóstico. Aclara conceptos como la biología normal de las células y la diferenciación celular.

name: Enfermedades mielodisplásicas y mieloproliferativas
content:
• Neoplasias mieloproliferativas y síndromes mielodisplásicos—Versión para pacientes

    Información del Instituto Nacional del Cáncer sobre el tratamiento de las neoplasias mieloproliferativas, así como referencias a estudios clínicos y otros temas relacionados.

name: Adenoid Cystic Carcinoma
content:
• Salivary Gland Cancer Treatment (PDQ®) (Health Professional)

    Expert-reviewed information summary about the treatment of salivary gland cancer. (Health professional version.)

name: Paylines
content:
• NCI Funding Policy for Fiscal Year 2016 Research Project Grant (RPG) Awards

    Information from NCI's Division of Extramural Activities.

  • Awards of R01 and R21 Grants in FY 2016

    Graphs and tables that summarize funding patterns for research project grants in Fiscal Year 2016.

name: Ductal Carcinoma In Situ (DCIS)
content:
• Breast Changes and Conditions

    Provides information on how specific breast changes, including atypical hyperplasia, lobular carcinoma in situ, ductal carcinoma in situ and breast cancer, are detected, diagnosed, and treated.

  • Breast Cancer Treatment (PDQ®)–Patient Version

    Breast cancer treatment depends on several factors and can include combinations of surgery, chemotherapy, radiation, hormone, and targeted therapy. Learn more about how breast cancer is diagnosed and treated in this expert-reviewed summary.

name: Melanoma
content:
• Cáncer de piel (incluye el melanoma)—Versión para pacientes

    Portal del NCI con información sobre el cáncer de piel, incluido el melanoma.

name: Primitive neuroectodermal tumors (PNET)
content:
• Childhood Central Nervous System Embryonal Tumors Treatment (PDQ®)–Patient Version

    Childhood central nervous system embryonal tumors and pineal tumors are treated with surgery, radiation therapy, chemotherapy, high-dose chemotherapy with stem cell rescue and targeted therapy. Learn more in this expert-reviewed summary.

  • Childhood Central Nervous System Embryonal Tumors Treatment (PDQ®)–Health Professional Version

    Treatment options for children with central nervous system embryonal tumors include surgery, chemotherapy, radiation therapy, stem cell rescue, and targeted therapy. Get detailed treatment information for untreated and recurrent CNS embryonal tumors in this clinician summary.

  • Ewing Sarcoma Treatment (PDQ®)–Patient Version

    Ewing sarcoma treatment usually begins with chemotherapy and/or radiation followed by surgery to remove any remaining cancer. Treatment options for recurrent sarcoma include targeted therapy and high-dose chemotherapy with stem cell transplant. Learn more in this expert-reviewed summary.

  • Ewing Sarcoma Treatment (PDQ®)–Health Professional Version

    Ewing sarcoma treatment options include multidrug chemotherapy, surgery, and radiation therapy. Treatment approaches titrate therapeutic aggressiveness to maximizing local control while minimizing morbidity. Get detailed treatment information for Ewing sarcoma in this summary for clinicians.

name: Diarrea
Hematologic/Blood Cancers
content:
• Cancers by Body Location/System

    A list of all cancers, organized by location and/or function in the body. Cancers on the list are linked to information about treatment, supportive care, screening, prevention, clinical trials, and other topics.

name: R03
content:
• Grant Mechanisms and Descriptions

    List of grant mechanisms, with descriptions and links to associated program announcements.

name: CCR
content:
• Center for Cancer Research

    CCR, the basic and clinical intramural research program of NCI, conducts research with the goal of improving the lives of people affected by cancer and HIV/AIDS.

name: Carcinoma
content:
• What Is Cancer?

    Understand how cancer cells differ from normal cells and genetics changes that cause cancer to grow and spread.

name: Epidemiology
content:
• Division of Cancer Epidemiology and Genetics

    DCEG conducts population and multidisciplinary research to discover the genetic and environmental determinants of cancer and the means of prevention.

  • Surveillance, Epidemiology, and End Results (SEER) Program

    The SEER Program of the NCI is an authoritative source of information on cancer incidence and survival in the United States.

  • Epidemiology and Genomics Research Program

    The Epidemiology and Genomics Research Program in DCCPS funds grants for scientists studying cancer causes and prevention in human populations.

name: Behavioral Research
content:
• Behavioral Research Program

    Initiates, supports, and evaluates a comprehensive program of behavioral research ranging from basic behavioral research to research on the development, testing, and dissemination of disease prevention and health promotion interventions.

name: TNM System

Dichos cánceres son el sarcoma de Kaposi, los linfomas de Hodgkin y no Hodgkin, y los cánceres de ano, de cérvix, de hígado y de pulmón. Trata también de lo que las personas con infección por VIH pueden hacer para reducir su riesgo de cáncer o para detectar temprano la enfermedad.

  • Childhood Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia Treatment (PDQ®)–Patient Version

content:
• NCI's Cancer Information Service (CIS)

The CIS provides personalized responses to specific questions about cancer and assistance to smokers who want to quit. Access the CIS by calling 1-800-4-CANCER or 1-877-44U-QUIT, or by using the LiveHelp instant-messaging service.
